params.periodType: 1. period type i.e. Hourly, Daily, Weekly, BiWeekly, Monthly, Yearly

PeriodModified(uint8,uint256).details: event to log that a period is modified

params.periodType: 1. period type i.e. Hourly, Daily, Weekly, BiWeekly, Monthly, Yearly

addPeriodsToPeriodType(uint8,uint256[],u.details: only owner can call this function

params._periodEnds: 3. array of the period ending timestamps to add
params._periodStarts: array of the period starting timestamps to add

params._periodEnds: 3. array of the ends of the period
params._periodStarts: 2. array of the starts of the period
params._periodType: 1. period type i.e. Hourly, Daily, Weekly, BiWeekly, Monthly, Yearly

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

periodDefinitions.details: period types are hourly / weekly / biWeekly / monthly / yearly

PeriodInitialized(uint8,uint256).notice: event to log that a period is initialized

addPeriodsToPeriodType(uint8,uint256[],u.notice: External function to add a new period definition

getPeriodDefinitions().notice: public function to get the definitions of period for all period types

getPeriodStartAndEnd(uint8,uint256).notice: public function to get the start and end of a period

initializePeriod(uint8,uint256[],uint256.notice: External function for creating canonical service level agreements

isInitializedPeriod(uint8).notice: public function to check if the period definition is initialized by period type

isValidPeriod(uint8,uint256).notice: public function to check if a period id is valid i.e. it belongs to the added id array

periodHasStarted(uint8,uint256).notice: public function to check if a period has started

periodIsFinished(uint8,uint256).notice: public function to check if a period has finished

userdoc.notice: PeriodRegistry is a contract for management of period definitions
